questions.question_text: Which attribute in the SDP for a call is affected by the static NAT address configuration in an Expressway-E?

discussion.content: This should be A connection

Selected Answer: A
Tough question. You could almost be convinced it is B, but this doc mainly points to c= connection.

 https://www.cisco.com/c/dam/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/expressway/config_guide/X8-5/Cisco-Expressway-Basic-Configuration-Deployment-Guide-X8-5-2.pdf

Selected Answer: A
the c= line - connection
Should be A
the answer is A (connection), NOT B
c-line shows the connection information, Media IP address. So if it is natted it will be reflected there.
I think the answer is B. its attribute c-line=connection. There is no attribute "name"

questions.question_text: Which describes what could done on the Expressway-E to successfully route calls from Expressway-C on the internal network to the Internet?

choices.C: The Expressway-E could be enabled for Dual-NIC capability.
choices.D: The Expressway-E could be enabled for interworking.
choices.B: A static NAT route could be added to the firewall to bridge the two networks.
choices.A: Application layer gateway could be enabled to bridge the media traffic.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Recommended: Dual NIC Static NAT Deployment The following example illustrates the recommended deployment. It shows the typical DMZ configuration where the internal and external firewalls cannot route directly to each other, and dual-NIC devices such as Expressway-E are required to validate and forward the traffic between the isolated subnets. 

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/expressway/config_guide/X14-0/basic_config/exwy_b_cisco-expressway-e-and-expressway-c-basic-configuration-deployment-guide-x14-0.pdf

Selected Answer: C
C is the answer
C is correct, ask about Expressway and not firewall

comments.content: But the question asks what could be done on the Expressway, B is a change to the firewall. I believe C is correct

discussion.content: B. A static NAT route could be added to the firewall to bridge the two networks.

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. What is the result of a transformation applied to alias 88514?

discussion.content: The answer should be 88514@ccnpcollab.com, since the regex considers anything after digit 8 (excludes 1-7), leaves the rest intact, and replaces the domain. So in short terms, it simply adds the domain after the DN.
Answer is C i tested in the check pattern tool on a EXP-E
Side note. All of the aliases in the answers are a match to this Transform, so if it's specified in the question any other answer it would be correct. Verified on Expressway

Selected Answer: C
I tested this on my Expressway-C and the alias match was 88514.

Selected Answer: C
[1-7] excludes 1-7 and replaces the domain with ccnpcollab.com. C is correct
Should be C
88514@ccnpcollab.com is correct
C. 88514@ccnpcollab.com

questions.question_text:
When configuring a Cisco Expressway solution and need to design the dial plan with various rules for URIs and numbers coming through the device. To do so, it is important that some dial plan rules are applied in a certain order. When configuring the transform section, you must know the range of the priorities.
Which range is correct?

choices.A: any number in the drop-down menu
choices.B: any number in the dialog box

discussion.content: D. any number between 1-65534

Selected Answer: D
Up to 100 pre-search transforms can be configured. Each transform must have a unique priority number between 1 and 65534.

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/expressway/admin_guide/X14-0/exwy_b_cisco-expressway-administrator-guide/exwy_m_dial-plan-and-call-processing.html

Selected Answer: D
D is the answer

Answer is D
https://www.cisco.com/c/dam/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/expressway/admin_guide/Cisco-Expressway-Administrator-Guide-X8-6.pdf

questions.question_text: Which zone is required on a B2B deployment between Expressway-C and Expressway-E?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A is correct

Selected Answer: A
A Traversal Zone
A. traversal zone
